FOREWORD 
We have officially entered the Age of Artificial Intelligence. The world is now set to change at a pace not seen in decades, even 
centuries. Al-based tools and applications make our lives easier, smoother, and richer. They help us move efficiently, get informed, 
get credit, get a job, and get our taxes done. 
But in its current form, Al reproduces and amplifies many of the social challenges we face. It is not acceptable that around a third 
of the world's population still lacks adequate internet access. Upstream, the Al industry is highly concentrated, with just two 
countries - the United States and China - and a dozen companies accounting for a major share of the sector. This can lead only 
to greater inequality of outcomes - including gender disparities - downstream. Non-diverse Al teams, unrepresentative datasets, 
and opaque and biased algorithms can cause harm, particularly to those who are already vulnerable, whether compani

recommendations.title: Develop a comprehensive national Al strategy that not only takes into account the contrasting contexts within the country, including variations in...
recommendations.text: Develop a comprehensive national Al strategy that not only takes into account the contrasting contexts within the country, including variations in rural versus urban development and gender disparities, but also emphasises on distinctive contributions to the Al ecosystem and delineates the country's innovative approach in the implementation process, with a whole of government and stakeholders approach.

recommendations.title: Prioritize on a review of existing legal and policy frameworks such as the Data Protection Act, 2019 and existing frame- works in sectors most likely...
recommendations.text: Prioritize on a review of existing legal and policy frameworks such as the Data Protection Act, 2019 and existing frame- works in sectors most likely to be impacted by Al such as education, health, culture, to ensure their readiness to cope with both the opportunities and risks brought about by Al and other emerging technologies.

recommendations.title: Ensure that the formulation of the national Al strategy is grounded in empirical evidence of ongoing Al initiatives, a com- prehensive understanding...
recommendations.text: Ensure that the formulation of the national Al strategy is grounded in empirical evidence of ongoing Al initiatives, a com- prehensive understanding of the multifaceted challenges faced in their development, and an evaluation of Al's impact on society and the economy. These efforts will aid in shaping the country's strategic direction.

recommendations.title: Prioritise Al governance frameworks that uphold human rights and core values, with an emphasis on marginalised popula- tions such as women, youth and...
recommendations.text: Prioritise Al governance frameworks that uphold human rights and core values, with an emphasis on marginalised popula- tions such as women, youth and children, and vulnerable groups as persons with disabilities and minority groups as well as rural communities. Implement policies that would ensure their inclusion and participation in the Al ecosystem.

recommendations.title: Leverage the advancements made in ICT as a solid foundation for the seamless integration and adoption of Al technol- ogies, and equip and empower...
recommendations.text: Leverage the advancements made in ICT as a solid foundation for the seamless integration and adoption of Al technol- ogies, and equip and empower institutions that have effectively integrated ICT into their respective sectors to serve as pioneers in embracing Al.

recommendations.title: Integrate ethical principles as recommended by UNESCO, such as proportionality and do no harm, transparency and ex- plainability, responsibility and...
recommendations.text: Integrate ethical principles as recommended by UNESCO, such as proportionality and do no harm, transparency and ex- plainability, responsibility and accountability, fairness and non discrimination, safety and security, right to privacy and data protection, among others, into Al governance frameworks and develop quantifiable indicators to gauge the attainment of these ethical standards.

recommendations.title: Setting up agile bodies for safeguarding and effective monitoring and implementation of mechanisms for redress in instances of non-adherence will be...
recommendations.text: Setting up agile bodies for safeguarding and effective monitoring and implementation of mechanisms for redress in instances of non-adherence will be essential to ensure the translation of ethical values and principles into actionable practices, notably through ethical impact assessment of specific aspects of development, procurement, deployment and use of Al technologies. liti 24i i P =\•j '' I] j{l){j •ii'@;j i {j ft j;flj fi j{@

recommendations.title: Launch programmes to promote public awareness and literacy to respond to national realities related to the responsible and ethical development,...
recommendations.text: Launch programmes to promote public awareness and literacy to respond to national realities related to the responsible and ethical development, adoption, deployment and use of Al, including for youth, women, and vulnerable and marginal- ised groups;

recommendations.title: Strengthen the capacities of governments, civil society, and the private sector to understand and make sense of Al tech- nologies and applications; ■...
recommendations.text: Strengthen the capacities of governments, civil society, and the private sector to understand and make sense of Al tech- nologies and applications; ■ ■

recommendations.title: Strengthen the capacities of governments, civil society and the private sector to develop, adopt, deploy, use and monitor Al ethically for the...
recommendations.text: Strengthen the capacities of governments, civil society and the private sector to develop, adopt, deploy, use and monitor Al ethically for the benefit of societies and people;

recommendations.title: Establish and enhance the capacity of policy, regulatory and enforcement institutions, also through targeted skills development and support for Al...
recommendations.text: Establish and enhance the capacity of policy, regulatory and enforcement institutions, also through targeted skills development and support for Al governance; and through leveraging on and including local, regional and international network of experts;

recommendations.title: Proactively engage in the mapping of jobs across board that would likely be affected or impacted by Al and emerging technology development and...
recommendations.text: Proactively engage in the mapping of jobs across board that would likely be affected or impacted by Al and emerging technology development and uptake, and deploy relevant capacity building and training programmes for skilling, reskill- ing and upskilling.

recommendations.title: Create a comprehensive evaluation methodology to identify the unique skill sets necessary across diverse industries, al- lowing for informed...
recommendations.text: Create a comprehensive evaluation methodology to identify the unique skill sets necessary across diverse industries, al- lowing for informed adaptation of school curricula and the establishment of personalised training programmes. Concur- rently, establish a national repository of skills data to systematically track existing gaps and evolving requirements.

recommendations.title: Ensure skilling and reskilling projects include a comprehensive knowledge of Al's societal ramifications, not just technical competencies.
recommendations.text: Ensure skilling and reskilling projects include a comprehensive knowledge of Al's societal ramifications, not just technical competencies. This involves empowering judicial officers to identify and deliver remedies for Al-related harms, cultivating an Al ethical culture through professional ethics bodies, and improving Al-driven disinformation detection capabilities.

recommendations.title: Take a diversified approach to bridge the digital divide to avoid increasing current disparities caused by Al adoption.
recommendations.text: Take a diversified approach to bridge the digital divide to avoid increasing current disparities caused by Al adoption. Beyond improving digital infrastructure and expanding training and skilling programmes, prioritise identifying and addressing underlying factors that contribute to this disparity, such as digital device accessibility and affordability, raising awareness about Al technologies, and fostering citizen trust in Al adoption.

recommendations.title: Prioritise increasing investment in the development of human resources specialised in Al innovation and establish a robust framework to facilitate...
recommendations.text: Prioritise increasing investment in the development of human resources specialised in Al innovation and establish a robust framework to facilitate coordination and collaboration among various governmental and non-governmental agencies tasked with spearheading Al innovation efforts.

recommendations.title: Establish research and innovation hubs in universities, research institutions, but also within government-led research institutions as well as in the...
recommendations.text: Establish research and innovation hubs in universities, research institutions, but also within government-led research institutions as well as in the private sector, with deliberate efforts to identify, nurture and retain Al talents, including through financial incentives and support to develop relevant Al solutions, and by by democratising initiatives as hack- athons and innovation challenges.

recommendations.title: Facilitate public-private sector collaboration to devise innovative financing models tailored to the unique needs of Al and emerging tech startups at different stages of development.
recommendations.text: Facilitate public-private sector collaboration to devise innovative financing models tailored to the unique needs of Al and emerging tech startups at different stages of development. These collaborative efforts should prioritise accessibili- ty, transparency, and inclusivity, ensuring that startups from diverse backgrounds and sectors have equitable access to financial resources and opportunities for scaling up their operations.

recommendations.title: Implement an approach to conduct regular impact studies aimed at evaluating the tangible outcomes and societal implications of investments in Al research and development (R&D).
recommendations.text: Implement an approach to conduct regular impact studies aimed at evaluating the tangible outcomes and societal implications of investments in Al research and development (R&D). These studies should encompass a comprehensive analysis of how Al investments contribute to knowledge production, innovation culture, technological advancements, economic growth,job creation, and societal well-being.

recommendations.title: Create and implement a comprehensive resource mobilisation strategy to diversify funding sources for Al initiatives.
recommendations.text: Create and implement a comprehensive resource mobilisation strategy to diversify funding sources for Al initiatives. In addition to government funding, this strategy should harness investment from the private sector, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), and foreign development partners in combining resources and expertise to advance Al innovation. ■ 75, 'Kenya - Information, Communications and Technology (ICT)' (19 August 2022) <https://www.trade.gov/country-commer- cial-guides/kenya-information-communications-and-technology-ict> accessed 24 April 2024 '2016-2030 Kenya National E-Health Policy.Pdf' <https://repository.kippra.or.ke/bitstream/han- dle/123456789/1786/2016-2030%20Kenya%20National%20E-Health%20policy.pdf?sequence=l &isAllowed=y> accessed 15 April 2024 '2018 Kajiado CountyCulture and Heritage Policy.Pdf' <https://repository.kippra.or.ke/bitstream/han- dle/123456789/1010/2018%20Kajiado%20Cou ntyCulture%20and%20Heritage%20Policy.pdf?sequence= 1 &isAI lowed=y> accessed 11 April 2024 'A Chief Kariuki Tweet Saved a Family in Nakuru' (Citizen Digital, 10 January 2018) <https://www.citizen.digital/news/a-chief-kari- uki-tweet-saved-a-family-in-nakuru-187676> accessed 23 April 2024 'About Smart Academy- Digital Skills' <https://www.smartacademy.go.ke/about-smart-academy/> accessed 23 April 2024 'AccesstolnformationActNo31 of2016.Pdf' <https://kenyalaw.org/kl/fileadm in/pdfdownloads/ Acts/ Accesstol nformationAct- No31 of2016.pdf> accessed 29 April 2024 Africa C for, 'Unmasking Hate Speech in Kenyan Elections with Al and Collaboration' (Code For Africa, 12 June 2023) <https:// med i u m.com/code-for-africa/u n ma ski ng-hate-speech-i n-kenya n-elections-with-a i-a nd-col la boration-5 7 6e3 7 d4ccb5 > ac - cessed 24 April 2024 Africa SR and S, 'How Al Is Affecting the Kenyan Workplace' (Summit Recruitment & Search, 4 September 2023) <https://www. summitrecruitment-search.com/how-ai-is-affecting-the-kenyan-workplace/> accessed 26 April 2024 'Al Career Essentials

legal_regulatory.title: Legal and Regulatory
findings: The report, the first document in the country that is specifically dedicated to Al and other emerging 'Kenya Law: The Constitution of Kenya' <https//www.kenyalaw.org/kl/index.php7id~398> accessed 27 April 2024.

On the legal and regulatory dimension, the presence of a Data Protection Act (2019) and evidence of its effectiveness lay a solid foundation for the ethical usage of personal data, an essential condition for the development of a human centred Al.

It outlines some of the key issues to be addressed by the Al masterplan as; the ethical, legal, and societal implications of Al, creation of shared public datasets and environments for Al training and testing and ensuring the safety and security of Al systems.6 The National ICT Policy 2019 and the K

on "Technology Trends" outlines 'Deep Learning; under which Al is considered as a subset of Machine learning, and its potential recognized merely from the perspective of data classification, trend identification and predictive analytics.

The draft of the first edition of the Information Technology-Artificial Intelligence Code of Practice for Al Applications was released in April 2024, for public review, by the Kenya Bureau of Standards (KEBS) .

• ·hi ti ij 4·); D; [I] }ti} j ,j ij ;)@,iii ti'til The Data Protection Act 2019 is the country's prevailing legislative framework that protects individuals' data and enforces responsible data processing practices as overseen by the Office of the Data Protection Commissioner (ODPC).
Since its enactment, the ODPC has received over 1600 registration applications from entities processing data.

Its mandate extends to protecting individuals' privacy, instituting legal and institutional mechanisms for data protection, and granting data subjects rights and remedies against unauthorized data processing.
strengths: The Distributed Ledger and Artificial Intelligence Taskforce established under Kenya Gazette Notice Number 2095 of 2018 to develop a roadmap for emerging technologies in the country, developed the Distributed Ledgers Technology and Artificial In- telligence Taskforce Report.

On April 8, 2024, the Kenyan government, through the MICDE, in partnership with the Deutsche Gesellschaft fUr Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ), launched the national Al strategy development process, with a series of stakeholders consultations workshops.

Following this, Makueni2° and Elgeyo Marakwet21 Counties established a contracting platform that employs open data to achieve transparency in the procurement process, signifying progressive steps towards the promotion of transparency and accountability in the procurement processes at a county level.
The National Cohesion and Integration Act 2008 was enacted in response to the hateful contents and deadly violence witnessed during the 2007 national elections.
Kenya's National Action Plan Against Hate Speech develops a comprehensive and coherent approach towards tackling hate speech in the country.
